text: of  $\mathbb{Q}(\sqrt{D})$  is not equal to the rank  $r_3(D')$  of the 3- part of the ideal class group of  $\mathbb{Q}(\sqrt{D'})$ , and therefore  $r_3(D) = r_3(D') + 1$  by Scholz's Reflection Theorem. By using the connection between the points of  $E_{D'}(\mathbb{Q})$  and the so- called 3- virtual units of  $\mathbb{Q}(\sqrt{D'})$ , we show that the elliptic curves of this subfamily, even though they have non- trivial rank, they cannot have any integral points. In the final section we discuss the case of positive fundamental discriminant  $D$  and derive a result for this case as well.

The notation and definitions of this section will carry throughout the paper. For the theory and proofs of the facts that we present here, the interested reader may refer for example to [12], [15, Chapter X.4 and Appendix B], [17] and [5, Chapter IV].
